tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Possible meanings are 1) David wrote the psalm or 2) the psalm is about David or 3) the psalm is in the style of David's psalms.

The words "my prayer" are a metonym for the person who is praying. See how these words are translated in [[:en:bible:notes:psa:039:012|39:12]]. AT: "Listen to me as I pray to you" or "Be willing to do what I ask you to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"please do what I ask you to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"Please do not judge" or "I beg you not to judge" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
The psalmist speaks of himself as if he were speaking of another person. AT: "me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])

tn.ref: in your sight no one is righteous
tn.text: "you do not think anyone is righteous" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"chased me to try to catch me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: has pushed me down to the ground
tn.text: "has completely defeated me" (see UDB)

tn.ref: My spirit is overwhelmed within me
tn.text: "I am weak" or "I am extremely discouraged"
"I no longer have any hope"
"think about"

The abstract noun "accomplishments" can be translated using the verb "accomplish." AT: "all that you have accomplished" or "all the great things you have done" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: spread my hands out to you in prayer
tn.text: "pray to you with my hands lifted up at my sides"

tn.ref: my soul thirsts for you in a parched land
tn.text: The psalmist speaks of wanting to be with God as if he were in a parched land and he also was about to die of thirst. AT: "I want to be with you the way a person in a parched land who is very thirsty wants water."
The psalmist desires to know Yahweh. The intensity of his desire to know Yahweh is like one who is very thirsty. AT: "I long for you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The soul is a metonym for the person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
A land where everything has died because there is no water.

This may be a musical term that tells people how to sing or play their instruments here. Some translations write the Hebrew word, and some translations do not include it. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:psa:003:001|3:2]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_transliterate]])
"I am weak" or "I am very discouraged" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: Do not hide your face from me
tn.text: This is a request. "I beg you not to hide from me" or "Please, do not hide from me"

tn.ref: Do not hide your face from me
tn.text: The psalmist speaks of Yahweh refusing to do what the psalmist asks as if Yahweh were refusing to even look at the psalmist. This litotes can be stated as a positive. AT: "Do not refuse to listen to me" or "Please listen to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])

tn.ref: I will become like those who go down into the pit
tn.text: "I will become just another dead person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: Let me hear your covenant faithfulness
tn.text: "Cause me to hear of your covenant faithfulness" or "Tell me of your covenant faithfulness"
Possible meanings are 1) "in the morning," at the time many people thought was the best time to pray, or 2) "morning by morning," every day.
"Tell me"

tn.ref: the way where I should walk
tn.text: The psalmist speaks of the way people live as if it were a path on which they walk. AT: "how you want me to live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: for I lift up my soul to you
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "I pray to you" or 2) "I believe that you will guide and protect me."

tn.ref: I flee to you to hide
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "I flee to you so I can hide" and 2) "I flee to you so you will hide and protect me."
"to do what you want me to do"

tn.ref: lead me in the land of uprightness
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "help me to live righteously" or 2) "may my life be free of trouble" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Possible meanings are 1) this is a metaphor for righteous living or 2) "a level land," a metaphor for life free of trouble. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"the enemies who want to take my life"

tn.ref: In your covenant faithfulness cut off my enemies
tn.text: "Show your covenant faithfulness by cutting off my enemies"
"the enemies of my soul" or, taking "my life" as a metonym for "me," "my enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
